title: Add Jira CLI with Write Permissions
description: Enable Claude to perform write operations on Jira issues by adding the Atlassian Jira CLI with a read/write token managed via 1Password. Existing read-only MCP remains unchanged.

title: Research and Test Jira CLI
description:
Understand Jira CLI capabilities and authentication requirements.

Actions:
- Install Atlassian's jira CLI on dev machine
- Identify which environment variables it uses for auth (likely JIRA_API_TOKEN)
- Test basic operations: list, create, view, edit, comment
- Document required config (JIRA_URL, JIRA_USER, etc.)
- Verify it works with BitGo's Atlassian instance

Acceptance:
- Document listing CLI commands needed for common operations
- Confirm read/write token can perform all desired operations
- No blockers identified

title: Create 1Password Item for RW Token
description:
Store read/write Jira token in 1Password.

Actions:
- Create Atlassian API token with read/write permissions
- Store in 1Password vault (suggest: op://Nix-Secrets/jira-cli-token)
- Structure: simple token field, no directory-specific logic needed
- Test retrieval: op read "op://Nix-Secrets/jira-cli-token/token"

Acceptance:
- Token stored and retrievable via op read
- Token has write permissions verified via manual Jira CLI test

title: Create 1Password Shell Plugin
description:
Build simple 1Password plugin for Jira CLI.

Actions:
- Create pkgs/op-plugin-jira/default.nix
- Implement plugin following 1Password SDK
- Define plugin metadata (name, description)
- Configure to inject JIRA_API_TOKEN env var
- Reference single token location (no directory logic)
- Much simpler than op-plugin-git-disjoint

Acceptance:
- Plugin builds successfully
- Can be loaded by 1Password CLI
- Running jira triggers 1Password biometric auth

title: Integrate Jira CLI into Nix Config
description:
Add Jira CLI to system packages with 1Password integration.

Actions:
- Add jira CLI to home.packages (around line 24 in profiles/bitgo/default.nix)
- Add op-plugin-jira to _1password-shell-plugins.plugins (line 65)
- Add activation script to install plugin to ~/.op/plugins/local/ (similar to line 52)
- Rebuild system config
- Verify jira command available

Acceptance:
- jira command in PATH
- Running jira prompts for 1Password biometric auth
- Auth persists for ~1 minute (1Password default)

title: Integration Testing
description:
Verify Jira CLI works alongside existing MCP.

Actions:
- Test MCP still works (read operations via Claude)
- Test CLI works (manual write operations)
- Test Claude can invoke Jira CLI for writes: create issue, update status, add comment
- Verify in Jira web UI
- Verify MCP and CLI don't conflict
- Test in both normal and --dangerously-skip-permissions modes

Acceptance:
- All operations successful
- No conflicts between MCP and CLI
- Both auth mechanisms work independently

title: Documentation
description:
Document new capability and setup.

Actions:
- Update AGENTS.md to mention Jira write capability
- Document 1Password token setup for new users/machines
- Note that MCP is read-only, CLI is read/write
- Add examples of write operations Claude can now perform

Acceptance:
- Clear documentation for future reference
- Setup instructions for reproducing on other machines
